intro: Centropogon mutisianus, commonly known as the Andean lily, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, violet or blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations between 2,000 and 4,000 meters. Its foliage consists of long, narrow leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Centropogon mutisianus is adapted to the cold, high-altitude environment and blooms during the warmer months of the year.
